text: the margin between the Pacific plate and
the North American plate is expressed in
California by a complex assemblage of
faults the San Andreas Fault
accommodates most of the relative
displacement between these two plates
generating seismic activity in the park
field segment this results in magnitude
6 earthquakes that repeat in average
every 20 years this animation shows a
dynamic simulation of the earthquake
cycle at park field which bears some
resemblance to the 1956 and the 2004
events the color intensity is related to
the velocity of slippage between the two
plates the history of slip includes
seismic ruptures for shocks and
aftershocks fault creep and episodic
slow slip events the model spontaneously
reproduces the location of the
nucleation of the latest to magnitude 6
earthquakes such simulations could in
principle be used to assess the full
range of earthquake patterns that a
particular fault system might produce
you
